TopicTitle: [YouTube] Building my Laythe Heavy Crawler Ferry

Articles.Content:
My first full length commentated video, showing the launch and assembly of the first two major components of my "Laythe Ferry", and the launch of one of the next stages which is left in orbit waiting for a LKO skycrane to move it to the ferry for docking.

Recorded and uploaded in 1600p, for those of you with larger displays. (recorded at 48fps but not able to encode above 30, so a little wasted)

Thanks Squad for a wonderful game!

and thanks Temstar for sharing the Nova rocket with us, available here:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/24787-0-19-1-Zenith-rocket-family

Just a heads up, its just over an hour and a half long

pre edit: the video is still uploading, as soon as its done i'll re-up this post but I just needed to get it posted while I was still on the pc rather than my phone.

Well, it's partly up, as of now it's done rendering the 720p version, the 1080p and 1600p versions will be up soon.

I know it's a long watch, but if you happen to skim through it let me know what you think

I do plan on continuing with commentated videos, but I really like the music video format too, so I'll still do those in between.

I hate to be that guy, but next time you should put your video in the "Fan Works" section

Sorry for backseat modding....
There isn't any 1600p resolution for youtube, also why so many nerva's?

there is, once its done rendering above the 1080p option there will be an option for Original, and since it was uploaded in 1600p, that's what you get. As for the LVN's, i kinda explain it in the video but the actual payload is 200 tonnes, plus 400 tonnes of fuel for the return trip. lower burn times and aesthetics honestly

Nuclear, i asked for a YouTube sub forum yesterday and the general consensus was to post in General instead anyway, sorry you don't agree:(

Edited April 25, 2013 by HoY
